node.title: Ferrari fans to celebrate F1 homecoming
node.description: Ferrari fans will be hoping to celebrate a triumphant homecoming at Imola after Charles Leclerc's early season domination raised expectations to the highest levels in years. The massed ranks of...

node.title: 'Vintage back to normal': Winegrowers hopeful of refilling cellars
node.description: There are promising signs of a much better grape harvest in the wake of a disappointing experience last year.

node.title: Stephen Colbert tests positive for COVID-19
node.description: New episodes of "The Late Show with Stephen Colbert" are set to return on May 2.

node.title: Satellite images appear to show new mass graves outside Mariupol
node.description: The imagery shows long rows of graves stretching away from an existing cemetery in the town of Manhush, some 12 miles from Mariupol.

node.title: Larry Nassar victims seek $130 million from FBI over bungled investigation
node.description: "This was not a case involving fake 20 dollar bills or tax cheats," one attorney said. "These were allegations of a serial rapist who was known to the FBI as the Olympic U.S. doctor with unfettered access to young women."

node.title: Best Buy recalls 772K air fryers after more than 100 catch fire
node.description: Product sold across the U.S. and Canada can overheat, and has been linked to minor property damage and two injuries.

node.title: Fed looks to hike interest rates half a point as inflation soars
node.description: The Fed raised its rate by .25% in March, which some experts felt was not enough.

node.title: Ardern lands in Tokyo: China on agenda for first meeting with Japan PM
node.description: Prime Minister Jacinda Ardern will meet her Japanese counterpart Fumio Kishida for the first time this evening.

node.title: McCarthy denies report he wanted Trump to resign after Jan. 6
node.description: The House minority leader allegedly told GOP leaders, "I've had it with this guy," according to a New York Times report.

node.title: West Coast shop damaged by sudden flooding
node.description: A shop owner on the West Coast is dealing with the damage of half a metre of water flooding inside, after a severe storm overnight.

node.title: Amazon extends Prime perks to merchant sites
node.description: Online retail giant's "Buy with Prime" service, geared to online stories, will initially be available by invitation only.

node.title: CDC issues health alert on rare cases of hepatitis in kids
node.description: Investigators have not yet found a link between the cases.

node.title: Boyfriend of University of Georgia professor acquitted in her death
node.description: In 2019, Marianne Shockley was found dead outside a hot tub. Her boyfriend was arrested and another man apparently died by suicide.

node.title: Police say Kaoss Price did not have firearm when fatally shot in Taranaki
node.description: Police have revealed the Taranaki man shot and killed by police on Saturday night was not armed.

node.title: Bernie Sanders hasn't ruled out third run for presidency
node.description: If Biden decides not to run for reelection, Sanders might run again, according to a memo written by a top Sanders adviser.

node.title: Mark Twitchell: Inside the mind of "the Dexter killer"
node.description: Police say Mark Twitchell was fascinated by the Showtime series "Dexter."   Newly revealed letters offer a rare look at the killer's thoughts.

node.title: Florida legislature passes map that could give GOP more U.S. House seats
node.description: Black members of the Florida state House protested the map's passage in the chamber.

node.title: Bidwell: Fans growing tired of NZ Rugby censorship
node.description: Analysis - The sporting public is tired of New Zealand Rugby censoring players' ability to speak candidly on controversies, writes Hamish Bidwell.

node.title: Tennessee bill requires drunk drivers to pay child support if parent killed
node.description: If the defendant is incarcerated and unable to pay the required child maintenance, they have one year after their release to begin paying.

node.title: Florida Legislature votes to strip Disney of special tax status
node.description: The move could have huge tax implications for Disney.

node.title: Working with assertive China a must, PM tells BBC
node.description: New Zealand has been aware for some time now of a "growing assertiveness" and a "growing interest" in its region - explicitly from China, Prime Minister Jacinda Ardern tells the BBC.

node.title: Unruly air passengers face up to $37,000 fine, FAA says
node.description: Air travelers may not have to wear masks anymore, but those behaving badly on planes will still face punishment.

node.title: Attorney says feds subpoenaed Hunter Biden paternity records, tax returns
node.description: "They wanted every record relating to Hunter Biden we had," attorney Clint Lancaster told CBS News.

node.title: Wimbledon bans Russian and Belarusian tennis players
node.description: Wimbledon barred Russian and Belarusian players from this year's championships due to Moscow's invasion of Ukraine.

node.title: Beach bylaws need enforcing, DOC ranger says
node.description: A lack of consequences for breaking bylaws restricting vehicle access to beaches in the Ōpōtiki district has meant an unsuccessful breeding year for New Zealand dotterel on Ōhiwa beach and spit.

node.title: Fury tickles Whyte ahead of world heavyweight showdown
node.description: Heavyweight world champion Tyson Fury and challenger Dillian Whyte went face-to-face with respect and a handshake ahead of this weekend's fight.

node.title: CNN+ to shut down less than a month after launching
node.description: Parent company Warner Bros. Discovery invested a reported $120 million into the streaming service only last year.

node.title: "90 Day Fiancé" announces death of 7-month-old baby
node.description: Anny Francisco announced the birth of their son in September, writing: "I thank God that he took care of me and everything went well."

node.title: Supreme Court says Congress can deny disability to Puerto Rico residents
node.description: The court ruled 8-1, with Justice Sonia Sotomayor as the lone dissenter.

node.title: Viral video showing police detaining crying 8-year-old boy sparks outrage
node.description: The Syracuse Police Department said they are looking into the actions of one of their officers after a viral video showed him detaining a crying 8-year-old boy.
